div.p: My mum and my dad divorced at 12, dad moved to Wolverhampton when I was 16 because they kept on swapping
you know we lived in a council estate and then mum would move and dad would live with us and dad would move and then
they kept on swapping until eventually dad moved to Wolverhampton and found a girlfriend there and then obviously mum stayed
that’s when obviously the discipline was out the house, that’s when I became all rebellious and stuff like that and you know
my 2 sisters, they’re both younger than me... Dad really hasn’t supported me with anything that I’ve done to be honest
like we’re just, you know, getting back to our relationship now but even when I went to Africa he was “no, don’t....”
there was always some negativity allowed to kick in you know and even my nan and all that sort of stuff, like my family
there was no support, you know, I never got no support like I never heard anyone say “you can do it”, “don’t give up”, none of that.
The only thing my dad used to say “what are you going to do when you’re older?” “what do you want to be when you’re older?”
but I think every kid’s had that talk with their parents “what do you want to be when you’re older?” “you’re wasting your life”
you know that was it but as a career like you know there was no motivation or anything like that, nothing.
I’m not hiding you know mum was an alcoholic you know she was a piss-head it’s what it is, you know, and I’m not...
all that shit that’s happened with them that’s affected me but it’s made me the person who I am today a semi-professional photographer
that still loves my mum, my dad and my sisters, you get me?
